So my reading of this error is that recvmsg call at this line of grpc code returned with ETIMEDOUT error

GPR_TIMER_BEGIN("recvmsg", 0);
  do {
    read_bytes = recvmsg(tcp->fd, &msg, 0);
  } while (read_bytes < 0 && errno == EINTR);
  GPR_TIMER_END("recvmsg", read_bytes >= 0);

There's a way to set timeout for a socket using setsockopt, but I couldn't find TensorFlow would be doing that by default, and I tested that it can successfully hang for 6 hours. So I guess the question is -- why would recvmsg fail with a timeout error? Perhaps that the behavior when connection is dropped/interrupted?
